subEvent.name: Public Resources
subEvent.description: The Public Resources day will explore several repositories providing access to published reference datasets composed of (but not limited to) images.

subEvent.name: Session 1
subEvent.description:
This session is aimed at our community
          attending from Oceania, Asia, Europe or Africa.

subEvent.name: Q&A session
subEvent.description: Discussion of invited talks, flash talks, and wider Public Resources topics

subEvent.name: Break-out sessions
subEvent.description: Workshop and round-table

subEvent.name: IDR Workshop
subEvent.description: Introduction to the IDR ecosystem will be shown on concrete examples of IDR studies. Images and metadata mining and comparison workflows will be presented. The first, hands-on section will show the cross-studies searches using OMERO.web. The second section will expand on these possiblities showing complex metadata mining and plotting as well as image reanalysis in Jupyter notebooks.

subEvent.name: Public Resources round-table
subEvent.description: Continued discussion on Public Resources topics.

subEvent.name: Break-out sessions
subEvent.description: Including IDR submission, IDR analysis and Public Resources round-table

Teaching and Training
subEvent.description: The Teaching and Training day aims to cover the use of open platforms like OMERO for teaching and how to train users or evaluate your favourite software/algorithms using platforms presented in Day 3 -- Public Resources, and how to take advantage of resources during Day 2 -- Research Data Management.

subEvent.name: OMERO trainers Workshop
subEvent.description: This session will introduce the materials available for running a successful OME workshop, lead you through the steps necessary for replicating OME Team training setups and discuss possible improvements and modifications of such setups.
